content:
Qing-Zeng Zhu is a Postdoc of organic geochemistry at the Hinrichslab. His research interests include stable isotope probing (SIP), organic matter (OM) fate in marine sediments, and geomicrobiology. He is currently working on a project about secondary production and its role in reshaping the OM pool after the deposition from primary production in the ocean.
  Download my resum√©.
summary: Qing-Zeng Zhu is a Postdoc of organic geochemistry at the Hinrichslab. His research interests include stable isotope probing (SIP), organic matter (OM) fate in marine sediments, and geomicrobiology. He is currently working on a project about secondary production and its role in reshaping the OM pool after the deposition from primary production in the ocean.
title: Qing-Zeng Zhu

content:
Trade war, communist party, ‚ÄúXinjiang concentration‚Äù, Covid-19, Huaiwei-5G, Tiktok‚Ä¶, When was your last time hearing something positive of China? Have you heard about China alleviating hundreds of millions of people out of extreme poverty, showing its incredible resilience in overcoming the effects of economic crisis, decisive implementation of rural revitalization strategy, achieving carbon neutrality before 2060 (keep in mind that China is still a developing country)‚Ä¶? Sometimes thing is not as simple as we think‚Ä¶ People definitely need a more objective way, especially abandoning their ideology, to understand China, and the people living there. When we look at what is happening in the West, we know that their systems are facing unprecedented challenges. However, no offense, the West is still judging the rest of the world with its superiority and arrogance. Now, it is time to cooperate and embrace diversities of global governance in key issues such as climate change, green energy etc.
Here is a Youtube channel to recommend: National Committee on U.S.-China Relations
summary: Trade war, communist party, ‚ÄúXinjiang concentration‚Äù, Covid-19, Huaiwei-5G, Tiktok‚Ä¶, When was your last time hearing something positive of China? Have you heard about China alleviating hundreds of millions of people out of extreme poverty, showing its incredible resilience in overcoming the effects of economic crisis, decisive implementation of rural revitalization strategy, achieving carbon neutrality before 2060 (keep in mind that China is still a developing country)‚Ä¶?
title: Story of China

content:
Tidyverse is a revolutionary package. I started from learning base R by taking some courses in Uni two years ago. However, the more I learned, the more I felt confused because there were always two solutions to one R question in stack overflow. Since then I realized the existence of tidyverse, especially from dplyr, and gradually switched to be a tidyverse person.
This is the tidyverse family:
Here is the tidyverse learning material from Dr.¬†Olivier Gimenez:
üçæü§™ Just updated my introduction to the #tidyverse to manipulate & visualise data in #rstat comments welcome ü§ó #datascience #davaviz Slides: https://t.co/O1gKF6Eenh
Code: https://t.co/As9bkXY9GZ pic.twitter.com/Uo7Hk9jj7d
— Olivier Gimenez üññ (@oaggimenez) October 22, 2020  
Here is the check and to-do list of my R (keep on updating):
tibblereadrdplyrtidyrforcatsggplot2 tip.1 use regular expression either on axis or legends if sub/superscript, Greek letters needed;
library(tidyverse)library(scales)ylab(expression(delta^{13}*"C"[CO2]))scale_color_manual(name = "",values = c("#ff6600", "#00b33c"),labels = c(expression(with ^{13}*"C lipids"), expression(without ^{13}*"C lipids")))stringr
purrr
readxl
lubricate
glue
Tidymodels is definitely my next package to learn after all the packages above are checked.
By the way, I create this website not only to show my information in academics, but also want to share some insights or knowledge I have acquired, for example, creating a website for free.
summary: R packages that help to bulid an easy career
title: R packages and tips (keep updating)

content: Secondary production in sediments may have been underestimated before. This process dominated by bacterial activities plays an pivotal role in reshaping the organic matter composition after sedimentation.
summary: Secondary production in sediments may have been underestimated before. This process dominated by bacterial activities plays an pivotal role in reshaping the organic matter composition after sedimentation.
title: Secondary Production in Marine Sediments

content:
This is my first time to create a website with the help of R package blogdown and Hugo. It was not as hard as I have imagined in the beginning, but as time going on, I found it necessary to know a little bit about all the underlying technologies like HTML, CSS, Hugo templating language, and JavaScript. I will keep updating if I am making a progress and keep in touch!
Usefull resources:
Alison‚Äôs website
summary: This is my first time to create a website with the help of R package blogdown and Hugo. It was not as hard as I have imagined in the beginning, but as time going on, I found it necessary to know a little bit about all the underlying technologies like HTML, CSS, Hugo templating language, and JavaScript.
title: Creating a website (keep updating)

content:
DARCLIFE (Deep subsurface Archaea: carbon cycle, life strategies, and role in sedimentary ecosystems) aims to study benthic archaea, their carbon cycle and life strategies in the deep subseafloor. It is a fruitful project which involves an interdisciplinary team of scientists from the fields of biogeochemistry, earth sciences, and microbiology. DARCLIFE started in April 2010 and is funded for five years through an Advanced Grant of the European Research Council. Even though it was finished 5 years ago, new finding benefited from this project has been continuing until today. I joined the project when I enrolled as a PhD student end of 2015.
Click HERE if you want to get more information.
Here is a small interview to the DARCLIFE project PI Prof.¬†Dr.¬†Kai-Uwe Hinrichs
summary: DARCLIFE (Deep subsurface Archaea: carbon cycle, life strategies, and role in sedimentary ecosystems) aims to study benthic archaea, their carbon cycle and life strategies in the deep subseafloor. It is a fruitful project which involves an interdisciplinary team of scientists from the fields of biogeochemistry, earth sciences, and microbiology.
title: DARCLIFE
Lipid analysis of CO2-rich subsurface aquifers suggests an autotrophy-based deep biosphere with lysolipids enriched in CPR bacteria
